page.title: 04Callow End Primary School.
page.content: Built in 1871,by Earl Beauchamp,and run by the National Society for Anglican Schools until 1952, when it was taken over by Worcestershire CC. The school's colours are royal blue,silver and grey.Previouly,there were school dinners, but now the pupils bring sandwiches from home. In 1965 there were 58 pupils,in 1975 120 pupils, and in 1985 only 58 pupils once more. There are 3 classrooms in the school. There have been many building alterations, such as the lowering of ceilings,and roofs put on the 2 toilets. The school has a television, computer, stereo record player and recorder, printing machine and photocopier. (See next page for more.)
